alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Decatur; Graham; Norton; Rawlins; Sheridan; Sherman; Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 25 at 10:20AM CST until December 27 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON MST /1 PM CST/ TODAY TO 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...From noon MST /1 PM CST/ today to 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult if not impossible. Road closures are likely, do not travel around barricades. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The dangerous conditions will impact holiday travel. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will overspread the area from east to west starting this afternoon. Very strong to damaging winds are also expected as well. The strongest winds look to be across east Colorado where potential for 60-65 mph exists. Winds of this magnitude and blowing snow may cause power outages.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne; Decatur; Graham; Norton; Rawlins; Sheridan; Sherman; Thomas
